Package com.unitedbankingservices

Interface IDevice<T extends IDeviceObserver>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of listeners used for this device. For a device whose class is X, its corresponding listener interface would typically be XObserver.
All Known Subinterfaces:
IBanknoteDispenser, ICoinDispenser
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBanknoteDispenser, AbstractCoinDispenser, AbstractDevice, BanknoteDispensationSlot, BanknoteDispenserMR, BanknoteInsertionSlot, BanknoteStorageUnit, BanknoteValidator, CoinDispenserAR, CoinSlot, CoinStorageUnit, CoinTray, CoinValidator
public interface IDevice<T extends IDeviceObserver>
Base type for all devices from United Banking Services.

This class utilizes the Observer design pattern. Subclasses inherit the attach method, but each must define its own notifyXXX methods.

Each device must be coupled to an appropriate listener interface, which extends AbstractDeviceObserver; the type parameter T represents this listener.

Any individual device can be disabled, which means it will not permit physical movements to be caused by the software. Any method that could cause a physical movement will declare that it throws DisabledException.

  • Method Details

    • isConnected

      boolean isConnected()
      Checks whether this device is connected to the power grid.
      Returns:
      true if this device is connected; otherwise, false.

    • isActivated

      boolean isActivated()
      Checks whether this device is connected to the power grid and activated.
      Returns:
      true if the device is connected, activated, and receiving power; otherwise, false.

    • connect

      void connect()
      Connects this device to the electrical power grid, leaving the power off. If the device is already connected or if it is already activated, this method does nothing.

    • disconnect

      void disconnect()
      Disconnects this device from the electrical power grid. If the device is already disconnected, this method does nothing.

    • activate

      void activate()
      Attempts to turn on the power to this device. If the device is already active or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing.

    • disactivate

      void disactivate()
      Attempts to turn off the power to this device. If the device is already disactivated or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing.

    • detach

      boolean detach(T observer)
      Locates the indicated observer and removes it such that it will no longer be informed of events from this device. If the observer is not currently registered with this device, calls to this method will return false, but otherwise have no effect.
      Parameters:
      observer - The observer to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the observer was found and removed, false otherwise.

    • detachAll

      void detachAll()
      All observers registered with this device are removed. If there are none, calls to this method have no effect.

    • attach

      void attach(T observer)
      Registers the indicated observer to receive event notifications from this device.
      Parameters:
      observer - The observer to be added.
      Throws:
      NullPointerSimulationException - If the argument is null.

    • disable

      void disable()
      Disables this device from receiving input and producing output. Announces "disabled" event. Requires power.

    • enable

      void enable()
      Enables this device for receiving input and producing output. Announces "enabled" event. Requires power.

    • isDisabled

      boolean isDisabled()
      Returns whether this device is currently disabled from receiving input and producing output. Requires power.
      Returns:
      true if the device is disabled; false if the device is enabled.
